titleStmt.title: Letter fom George Bullock to His Sister

body.div: Your letter to me was received Monday the 19th and I was glad to get it too, it was the first time your letters were more than a week a part apart. I don't believe anything unusual has happened since I wrote to Lucy the first part of the week. We did not have any of that snow that you all had, we had wind and a little snow but did not any stay on the houses even. I don't know whither I to Lucy about how we were going to get a long with one suit of uniform. We wont hvae to wear the uniform all the time and wont have to wear it on Sundays.

We will have to get the uniform about the middle of March. One of our Professor has just gotten back from his home where he went to attend his fathers funeral. Col. Holladay has just gotten back from the NEWBORN fair, he said he would have had a very pleasant time if it had not been such a crowd. Prof. Irby has gone to Statesville to a farmers meeting. Prof. Massey gave us a little talk, as he called it, in the chapel tonight. I think he will also go to Statesville tonight. I have two jobs for me tomorrow, one is with Mr. Skinner the other is helping Mrs. Holladay _____. I had rather help Mrs. Holladay to move but as I promised Mr. Skinner to work for

him I reckon I will have to work for him. I debated in my society tonight for first time in I dont know when. I started a letter to Jud last Sunday and ____ it up before I finished it, and have not finished it yet. I reckon Walter has written you all the news so I will close with love to all I shall ever remain your loving Bro. G. T. Bullock
